readability_reflection: I believe complete string interpolation like https://{domain_name}/{path}/{a.id} is more readable because the string is already partially made for us, as compared to a string concatenation like hvar + domain_name + "/" + url + "/" + a.id. The second example I made above is also longer and thus requires more reading and keen eyes to follow, therefore being less readable to me.
comprehension_debugging: No challenges to using string interpolation or concatenation when understanding or debugging code, but I did feel more of an advantage when it came to strings that were more string interpolated heavy. I feel like they gave me an advantage mainly when it came to readability.
preference_rationale: I would choose string interpolation for future programming tasks, the main factor that influenced my choice is because in python (as of late) I have used a lot more string interpolation in my string outputs than actual concatenation.
learning_curve: My prior experience with both string interpolation and concatenation played a role in understanding the provided code examples, for example I feel like I have a keen experience on keeping track of variables within {}, noticing beginning " and ending " then distinguishing how the string would look.
suggestions_improvement: No suggestion or recommendation that came to mind as I did this survey, but I do now better like string interpolation over concatenation.
